stadium.name: The Hollow Mine
stadium.description: The playing field is the circular, wildflower-covered clearing at the base of the imposing, ivy-covered Watch Tower. The ground hums with a strange energy, and the home team makes their entrance from the newly-opened mine shaft that bores deep into the tower's foundation.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing how many dried beans they can fit in their nostril.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.

stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è LIVE FROM THE HOLLOW MINE: THE DECIDER! üèüÔ∏è

Greetings, ghouls, ghosts, and glorious gladiators of Osterra! Your favorite demon of the airwaves, Nok the Corrupter, is coming to you live from the base of the Watch Tower in Wyrmwood Hollow! Folks, we have reached the pinnacle of tension! The series is tied 1-1, and this is the rubber match! It‚Äôs the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres against the Wyrmwood Stronghammers, and only one of these teams is walking away with a ticket to the next round while the other gets a one-way trip to the loser's bracket! Can you feel that? The ground is humming with energy, or maybe that's just my own excitement vibrating through the floorboards! ‚ö°üèóÔ∏è

Look at those Stronghammers down there, fueled by the draft of the mine and the raw, unbridled spirit of the Grove! Sabian Gleason is currently ignoring his teammates to count the few clouds visible from the clearing‚Äînow that‚Äôs a man with his priorities straight! And I just saw Kerwin Gasper practically begging the referee to bless their Kriegsmesser. Talk about divine intervention! They‚Äôve got the home-field advantage with those 'Tangled Vines' waiting to snatch a leg, and if the Bizarres aren't careful, they'll be buried under more than just wildflowers! üåºüî®

But don't you dare look away from the Bizarres! These flamboyant fighters are bringing the circus to the mine! I see Pompei Hephzipa striking aggressive, theatrical poses that would make Kython the Ringleader weep with joy! And look at Aggri Cookie, staring so intently at his gauntlets you‚Äôd think he‚Äôd never seen hands before! They‚Äôre looking to steal this series right out from under the Hammers‚Äô noses, and if they can avoid the lagoon-less 'Lagoon Splash' and keep their feet on this humming earth, we‚Äôre in for a real treat! ü§°üé™

This playoff atmosphere is absolutely electric, even if the popularity polls are split! I‚Äôd much rather be watching my Ebon Gate Corruptors, but since they aren't on the schedule, this carnage will have to do! It‚Äôs better than watching the Haven Lights preach about 'fair play' and 'goodness.' Give me a maul to the face any day of the week! The bar is open, the players are primed, and the Trollball is ready for some post-season punishment! Let‚Äôs get it on! üçªüèà
postGame:
# üèÜ THE BIZARRES BRAVE THE HOLLOW! SERIES WON 2-1! üé≠

Holy smokes, what a peach of a game! If you like your sports with a side of total physical annihilation, then you were in the right place! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres have done it! They‚Äôve marched into the Hollow Mine and walked out with a 4 to 2 victory, clinching the series and sending the Wyrmwood Stronghammers packing to the loser's bracket! It was a real seesaw of a battle that saw more bodies hit the wildflower-covered floor than I‚Äôve seen since the last time Sir Artorias tried to 'save' a village! üèóÔ∏èüí•

The Bizarres came out swinging‚Äîliterally! Early in the first half, Demp Chet secured the Trollball and it wasn't long before Pompei Hephzipa showed us why he's the star of the show! He lined up a shot from Center Field and nailed it right into the basket for a 2-point lead! The theatrical poses must be working, folks, because that was pure, unadulterated precision! The Stronghammers looked stunned, probably wondering if the humming earth was actually a funeral dirge for their season! üéØü§°

But the Hammers didn't just sit there! Rebane Kendy snatched up the ball and tried to mount a counter-attack, but the Bizarres' defense was stickier than the 'Tangled Vines' lining the field! We saw wild passes from Autumn Jodoin that went absolutely nowhere, and Aggri Cookie was there to scoop up the scraps! It was a display of chaotic scrambling that would make even the shadow king Dima jealous of all that confusion! ü¶éüå™Ô∏è

Then, the brutality reached a fever pitch! The first half turned into a total butcher shop! Odelia Abbott decided to use that whip to some effect, tackling Milo Nelie so hard he had to be carted off the field! Not to be outdone, Calvinna Isador delivered a bone-shattering hit to Melesa Zelten, and Rebane Kendy flattened Gagliano Tallbott! The healers, Essa Pattie and Hamburger Marthe, were working overtime, probably wishing they‚Äôd stayed in bed! üè•üíÄ

Despite the injuries, the Bizarres kept their eyes on the prize! Willa Lois, looking like a blur on the field, charged into the Home Field zone and fired off another 2-point shot! BOOM! Just like that, it was 4-0! The Stronghammers were looking more like 'Weak-mallets' at this point, unable to stop the bleeding or the scoring! It‚Äôs a good thing the ground hums, because the home fans were dead silent! ü§´ü•Å

Right before halftime, the Hammers finally found some life! Autumn Jodoin, perhaps fueled by that raw egg he chugged earlier, found himself in Away Field and launched a beautiful 2-point shot that found the mark! 4 to 2! There was a glimmer of hope for the Wyrmwood faithful! Could they pull off the miracle? Could they prove that literacy isn't required to win at Trollball? ü•öüî®

The second half was a defensive masterclass and a total bloodbath combined! Pompei Hephzipa showed some real 'hero' potential‚Äîthe bad kind‚Äîby intercepting a pass from Cornela Piscatelli! That really took the wind out of the Hammers' sails. You could tell the 'Mine Draft' was blowing cold for the home team as they struggled to find any rhythm against the Bizarres' flamboyant wall! üß±üå¨Ô∏è

The violence didn't let up for a second! Calvinna Isador managed to take out Demp Chet, and Ultun Barthelemy sent Quintessa Austine to the sidelines with a crunching tackle! It‚Äôs a shame Count Trez Arrigo wasn't here to see his team struggle; he probably would have tried to bribe the referee or at least tax the Bizarres' costumes! üí∞ü§ï

In the end, the clock was the Hammers' greatest enemy. Despite several attempts to run the ball and some valiant tackles from Kerwin Gasper, they just couldn't crack the Bizarres' code. The 'Humming Earth' seemed to be singing for the visitors today! The Bizarres played with the kind of reckless abandon I haven't seen since the Demon Prison was busted open by those 'adventurers'! üåÄüõ°Ô∏è

Final score: 4 to 2! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres take the game and the series 2-1! They move forward in the winners' bracket, while the Wyrmwood Stronghammers have to lick their wounds and figure out how to climb out of the loser's bracket. It was a magnificent display of everything I love about this game‚Äîbroken bones, stolen dreams, and a leather head in a basket! üèÜüéÜ

I‚Äôm Nok the Corrupter, and I‚Äôm heading to the bar to see if I can find some of that ritual sangria Elspeth Ortell is always talking about! It‚Äôs going to be a long night of celebration for the troupe! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! Goodnight, you beautiful monsters, and remember: if you're going to lose, at least make sure you leave a mark! üéôÔ∏èüñ§
